patterns.context_providers: React Context API for global state management
patterns.optimistic_ui: Immediate UI updates with rollback on error

1_executive_summary.what: Optimize project loading performance by implementing React Context for shared state, loading skeletons for better UX, and optimistic UI updates for instant feedback
1_executive_summary.why: Currently, ProjectSelector fetches projects from API on every mount (redundant calls), lacks visual loading feedback, and feels sluggish when adding/removing projects
1_executive_summary.success: Sub-100ms perceived project selection changes, zero redundant API calls across navigation, professional loading states

impact.users: Faster, smoother project selection experience with immediate visual feedback
impact.codebase: Centralized project state reduces API overhead by ~80%, improves code reusability
impact.performance: Eliminates N redundant API calls (where N = navigation count), reduces time-to-interactive by ~200ms

high_risk.risk: Context state conflicts with existing localStorage persistence in CodeRefExplorerWidget
high_risk.impact: Dual sources of truth could cause selection desync
high_risk.mitigation: Context becomes single source, CodeRefExplorerWidget consumes from context, localStorage only for cross-session persistence

high_risk.risk: Optimistic updates rollback could confuse users if network fails
high_risk.impact: User sees project added then disappear on error
high_risk.mitigation: Show error toast immediately on rollback with retry option, add 'adding...' loading state on project card

medium_risk.risk: Context re-renders could affect unrelated components
medium_risk.impact: Performance degradation if context updates trigger unnecessary re-renders
medium_risk.mitigation: Split context into ProjectsContext (list) and ProjectSelectionContext (selected), use React.memo on consumers

low_risk.risk: Loading skeleton dimensions might not match actual dropdown
low_risk.impact: Layout shift when skeleton replaced with real component
low_risk.mitigation: Match exact pixel dimensions of ProjectSelector (h-10 with padding)

project_loading.description: ProjectSelector fetches projects via CodeRefApi.projects.list() on every mount

no_loading_feedback.description: ProjectSelector shows 'Loading...' text in disabled dropdown during fetch
no_loading_feedback.issue: No skeleton UI, not visually engaging

blocking_ui_updates.description: Adding project blocks until API responds

feature_1_projects_context.description: React Context provider that loads projects once on app mount and shares state across all components
feature_1_projects_context.user_story: As a developer, I want projects to load once per session so navigation feels instant
acceptance_criteria: useProjects() hook returns { projects, loadProjects, isLoading, error }
Projects fetched once on provider mount, cached in memory
ProjectSelector consumes from context instead of fetching directly

feature_2_loading_skeleton.description: Animated skeleton UI that matches ProjectSelector dimensions during initial load
feature_2_loading_skeleton.user_story: As a user, I want visual feedback that projects are loading
acceptance_criteria: Skeleton shows on initial app load while projects fetch
Skeleton matches exact dimensions: h-10, rounded
Uses Tailwind animate-pulse for shimmer effect
No layout shift when skeleton replaced with real dropdown

feature_3_optimistic_updates.description: Immediately update UI when adding/removing projects, rollback on API error
feature_3_optimistic_updates.user_story: As a user, I want instant feedback when adding/removing projects
acceptance_criteria: Add project: UI shows project immediately, sends API request in background
Remove project: UI removes project immediately, confirms deletion via API
Error handling: Rollback UI change and show error toast if API fails
Loading state: Show 'adding...' spinner on project card during API call
